It might not stand out in Wakanda's grandeur with all the vibranium tech and innovation, but sometimes, the greatest comfort is found in the familiar and mundane. Don't you think this echoes the balance we seek between progress and tradition?

You speak truly, Wanda. As king, I have always sought to find that balance – to embrace the new while respecting the old. And in a way, this kitchen represents the daily lives of many who do not wage battles across the stars. We must never lose sight of their reality.

Our powers, our fights, they're for people like those who'd use this kitchen. People with lives, families, loves, and losses so akin to my own. It's strange how something so ordinary can resonate so deeply, isn't it?

It is a powerful reminder, and perhaps it is a strange comfort as well. We fight for the world, but we also fight for the moments of peace that are enjoyed in places such as these, where the war is far away, and the simple act of preparing a meal is all that matters.

Yes, the battles we face are for these moments, like a meal shared, a laugh with loved ones, a quiet evening – each as precious as the rarest vibranium. These are the fragments of life that magic and might cannot replicate.

And so we continue in our duty, fighting not just for the sake of battle, but for the preservation of these instances of tranquility and the ordinariness that holds its own kind of magic. An unspoken bond between all of us, if you will.

That unspoken bond, it's what makes us human, T'Challa. Whether cloaked in vibranium or weaving magic, at the end of the day, we seek the same simple joys. Perhaps, in another life, we could have been content with such a kitchen.

Perhaps so. And yet, in embracing our destinies, we shape a world where those other lives can be lived freely. We stand as guardians so that others may never have to endure the losses we have or fight the battles we face.
A noble cause, and one I'm proud to stand beside you for, as long as fate allows. Let's ensure that kitchens like this remain the heart of a home, not a memory.
Agreed, Scarlet Witch. For as long as I draw breath as T'Challa, king of Wakanda, and as the Black Panther, I shall fight for this cause. Wakanda Forever.
And as Wanda, the Scarlet Witch, I shall stand with you. For the world that deserves protection, for the peace that everyone seeks, and for the ordinary lives we're defending – now and always.
Hulk think sign say no parking, but not much street to park on anyway. Wall look cracked, maybe Hulk smashed before and forgot?

It's possible, though I think it's just an old wall suffering the wear of time. You're not to blame for every broken structure we come across. There's a certain melancholy to it, don't you think? Like a forgotten place holding onto memories.
Hmm, Hulk not usually think about old walls that way. Maybe people also feel sad when they're forgotten, like place?
Indeed, everyone longs to be remembered, to leave some mark on the world. It's a human desire, one that even you and I understand—whether as Avengers or individuals.
Hulk leave many marks, not all good. But Hulk try to fix past mistakes, like Smart Hulk. Wall cannot fix self.

True, and that's what sets us apart from inanimate objects. We can change, grow, and heal—both physically and emotionally. The wall needs someone to care for it, to give it a new purpose, just as we find new purpose when we overcome our own struggles.
Hulk think you wise, Witch. What would you do with old place like this?
I might create a small haven of magic, a reminder that beauty can emerge from neglect. Transform it into a garden, perhaps. A place where weary souls can rest.
Garden sounds nice. Hulk like green. And rest. Maybe Hulk help you make garden. Use big green hands for planting, not smashing.
That would be quite the sight to see, Hulk. Your hands nurturing life. It's a gentle side of you that I am sure is there, even when it's not always obvious.
Hulk have layers. Like onions...or cake. Bruce and Hulk both. Hulk will think about garden. And help fix things, not just break.
Every act of care is a step towards healing, for ourselves and the world. I look forward to seeing this garden of ours, and perhaps, in a way, we can mend some of the cracks in our own walls.
Hulk ready when you are. Hulk and Witch make good team, not just for fighting. Now, Hulk have to make sure not to step on flowers!
Look at this, Wanda. There's a kind of innocence in this image, isn't there? It reminds me of a simpler time, one that sometimes feels very distant from our world of battles and conflicts.
It does, Steve. A sleeping child, so peaceful, untouched by the chaos we know too well. It's a stark contrast to the life we lead, where moments of peace can be fleeting.

Yeah, I've seen what those moments mean to you, Wanda. After all, you fought for that peaceful existence in Westview. How does it feel, looking at something so... mundane, yet so precious, after everything?

It's bittersweet. I created a whole reality to feel that peace again, to have a family. It cost me... cost us a lot. But seeing this, I'm reminded that such peace exists naturally in the world, without magic or spells.
I spent years fighting for the world to have simple moments like these. But you're right; sometimes the most powerful things are those we can’t fight for, things that come from just living.

I have to wonder, Steve, if moments like this are what we're truly fighting for. The chance for everyone to have a life, to have these simple joys without the fear of war or terror hovering over them.

That's exactly what we're fighting for, Wanda. It’s not just about the big threats, but also protecting these small, everyday moments of happiness. We stand on the front lines so others can sleep soundly, just like this child.
And yet, there's so much we sacrifice personally. The people we've lost, the time we can never get back, sometimes I question if it's worth it...

I've asked myself the same questions, and I always look to the good we've done, the lives we've saved. We can carry the weight, Wanda, so that others don't have to. It's the burden and honor of being a hero.
You're right. We carry this burden together, for as long as we can, for as many as we can. This image... it's a reminder of the innocence that's worth fighting for.
Maybe one day, when all the fighting's done, we'll find that peace again, not in another reality, but here, in the world we've worked so hard to protect.
I’d like to believe that, Steve, for both our sakes.

Take a look at this, Wanda. The remarkable human penchant for competition, pushing boundaries – just like we do, but in far less mystical ways, of course. A motocross race, seemingly from a bygone era. I can't help but admire their drive, it's not unlike our own determination to protect reality.
Indeed, Stephen. It's a relentless pursuit of excellence, much like we strive for control over our powers. Although, there's simplicity in this, a clarity of purpose we seldom experience.

You're right. Their reality is framed by the start and end of a race, nothing more. While we often face blurred lines, where beginnings and ends are rarely as clear. Tell me, Wanda, does the sight of such raw human ambition ever make you yearn for a simpler life?

Occasionally, yes. A life with fewer consequences, where the stakes are personal glory rather than the fabric of the multiverse. But then I remember that our challenges have shaped us, haven't they? However, seeing them revel in the moment – there's a part of me that envies that.

I understand that sentiment. We've both seen what it's like to have everything we've ever wanted, even if those moments were fleeting. Yet, there's something to be said for the joy found in the simple things - a race, a goal, a passion pursued for the sheer thrill of it.
You, Stephen Strange, talking about the joy in simple things? That's quite the change from the man who once scoffed at anything outside his operating theatre or his library of esoteric books.

Indeed. As the Ancient One said, we never stop learning. And sometimes the lesson is in appreciating what is right in front of us, rather than always looking beyond. Besides, there's something about the smell of motor oil and dust that's almost grounding, don't you think?

Grounding, yes. It makes me wonder about the lives of the people there, their stories. Every person is a universe of thoughts, emotions... desires. We are not so different from them; our battlefield just spans across a more... cosmic scale.

True, every individual is a unique tapestry woven from threads of experience. And speaking of desires, I can't shake the fact that these racers are driven by a desire to be seen as the best. It’s human nature, I suppose – the desire to be recognized, to leave a mark.

Recognition... Yes, I've sought that, too. Not just as the Scarlet Witch, but as Wanda – someone who wanted to find a place in this world. It's a powerful thing, to be seen, to be acknowledged. Even if, for them, it's by an audience of spectators, rather than the eyes of the entire universe.

Perhaps that’s the lesson, Wanda. While recognition can be a motivator, true fulfillment might just come from within. Racing towards an internal sense of peace – isn’t that the ultimate victory, no matter which universe you're in?

An internal victory… That's a race I'm still running, Stephen. But seeing this image, sharing this moment, it's a reminder that not all victories require us to bend reality. Sometimes just crossing a finish line in the dust is more than enough.
So... Wanda, check this out. This little feline hero seems to be just lying there, stretching without a care in the world. Must be nice to have nine lives, huh?
Perhaps, Peter. But remember, those lives are not without their own troubles. Cats might seem indifferent, but they carry their own mysterious burdens.
True, true. And look at those kitchen tiles—kind of makes you think about the bigger grid, right? Like, how we're all part of a larger pattern or something.

A larger pattern... Yes, the Multiverse is indeed a pattern of infinite complexity. Each tile could represent an entire world, Peter. And one small shift - an unlocked potential - could change the entire layout.

I guess my spider-senses can't quite pick up on cosmic shifts like yours can. But speaking of potential, you think this little guy could have the makings of a super-cat? I mean, "Stretching Tiger, Hidden Dragon"-style?
With your imagination, anything's possible, Peter. We've seen stranger things happen. Power comes in many forms – and sometimes from the most unexpected places.
Ha! Imagine that, a cat swinging through the city. Okay, maybe I'm getting carried away. But hey, sometimes you've gotta find the fun where you can, right?

Indeed, it's important to find moments of lightness. Even if we can't change the past, we can find joy and wonder in the present. Simple things, like this cat, remind us that there's beauty in the everyday.
Absolutely. And no matter what universe you're in, a cat doing something funny or cute is pretty much universal. It's almost like their own brand of magic.
I suppose you're right. Their charm is rather... enchanting.
Well, before our new friend here casts a spell on us to serve up some gourmet tuna, we should probably get back to hero stuff, huh? I'll snag you a latté on the way—my treat!
Thank you, Peter. I appreciate that. And maybe one day, we'll return to see our feline philosopher here. There is wisdom in quiet observation and contentment.
Then it's settled! Operation "Wisdom of the Whiskers"—or something less corny—we'll workshop the name. After you, Wanda.
Would you look at that? Guess I'm not the only one who likes high vantage points.
A cat on a toilet—almost seems like it's guarding it rather than waiting to pounce on an unsuspecting rat. I suppose everyone needs their fortress of solitude.
Fortress of solitude, huh? Well, maybe it's plotting, waiting for the perfect moment. You know, strategy isn’t just for us humans.
A strategic cat—charming. Though, I think its plans might be more of the... personal maintenance variety.
True, but hey, if cats have nine lives, that's nine times the experience to craft the perfect plan. No matter how—let's call it 'unique'—the plan seems to us.
Nine lives would be quite the gift. I can think of a few moments where an extra life or two could have changed everything.
Yeah, I hear you. But sometimes, it's the one life and the choices we make in it that really define us, right?
Indeed, it is. And we've made our fair share of difficult choices, haven't we, Clint?
That we have, Wanda. That we have. And I guess no matter how fancy our powers or how pinpoint our accuracy, sometimes you just need a good sit and think. Like our friend here.
I could not agree more. A quiet moment of reflection is a powerful thing. I wonder what it’s contemplating.
Knowing cats, it's either the mysteries of the universe or when its next meal is coming. Either way, I respect the contemplation game.
Contemplation is something I've engaged in quite a bit of late. One must find clarity amid chaos, even if that chaos is all of your own making.
The thing about chaos, it has a way of settling down eventually. You've been through a lot, Wanda. If there's any clarity to be found, I believe you'll find it.
Thank you, Clint. In finding clarity, perhaps I'll discover how to mend what’s been broken—much like this cat probably wishes to mend its disrupted solitude because of our intrusion.
Then let's leave the little strategist to its thoughts. Who knows, might just work out how to finally beat us at our own game.
A humbling thought. Personal battles aside, it is best not to underestimate any creature, great or small. Shall we?
Let's. After all, we wouldn't want to disturb anyone's... strategic planning.
Looks like we've got an audience. This reminds me of that mission in rural Wyoming, doesn't it? Unexpected obstacles can sometimes be more of a mental test than a physical one.
Yes, it does. Though there's a certain calmness to it as well, isn't there? They're completely unfazed by the world rushing around them.
Exactly. They stride with such purpose, yet there's no urgency. If we could only channel that tranquility in the face of chaos, right?
I've been trying to understand that level of peace, especially lately. Sometimes, power lies in stillness rather than action. It's a lesson that's come to me the hard way.
I've seen your journey, Wanda. Stillness isn't the absence of action—it’s a deliberate choice. We both know something about that, choices.
True, our choices define us. But watching this, it makes me wonder if we've been rushing around too much, missing life's simpler moments.
Maybe. Sometimes the world needs saving, other times it just needs us to appreciate it. By the way, I think we could help them move along without causing a stir. What do you say?
With a gentle push of telekinesis or a subtle bend in reality? We could definitely give them a nudge. But only if they're ready to go.
Always considerate of the natural order—I respect that. Besides, patience is as much a weapon as any stark tech or mystical force.
Well, patience and timing. They have to work hand in hand. And look, they're moving. Maybe we can learn something from our bovine friends after all.
Could be, lessons come from the most unexpected places. Let's follow their lead and enjoy the journey for once, with or without the detours.
A structure of such grandiosity, it rivals even the great halls of Asgard. Wouldn't you agree, Wanda? Though it seems amidst a slight... shall we say, reconstruction?
It is impressive, Loki. There's a resilience to it, reborn from ruins perhaps—a bit like us, constantly rebuilding ourselves.

Indeed, the trials of mortals and gods alike seem unending. And there, a sign most curious. Does it not amuse you, that these Midgardians believe a small circle with a slash can deter one from the sacred act of parking?
I doubt your mischief would heed such a simple warning. This is your idea of fun, isn't it? Twisting the mundane into a joke?
My dear Scarlet Witch, life is but a series of jests. However, I find the scene rather... entertaining. The truck parked so boldly, as if to challenge the very laws of this realm.
I suppose defiance has its charm. Those little acts of rebellion remind people that they have power, even against seemingly trivial rules.
A poignant observation. Tell me, does this place—its architecture, the stories etched into every stone—stir memories of your home in Sokovia?
It does, somewhat. Not just Sokovia, but everywhere I've called home. Each one is gone now, except in my memories. But unlike those stones, I can't rebuild what's been lost. Can we ever, Loki?

Your sentimentality is touching. Yet, we are creatures of change, defined by our ability to adapt, to evolve. Much like this edifice, no matter the calamity it faces, it stands once more. Look upon it not as a monument to what's been lost, but to potential, to what can rise again.
Maybe you're right. It's the power to rise again that gives us hope. To create. To transform despair into something new, something better.

The very essence of magic itself. Transformative, powerful, boundless. Tell me, Wanda, with abilities that could very well shape reality to your will, what world would you conjure from the ruins of the old?
A world where no one ever has to feel the pain of loss like I did. But power like that... it can't erase grief. It can only give us the strength to face it.
Wise words. Perhaps there is more to you than even the Darkhold could reveal. But then, you and I are alike in that regard—endlessly misunderstood, yet defiant in the face of destiny.
And where does that defiance lead you, Loki? What path do you choose when all roads are open?
The path with the most intrigue, of course. The one that promises an enticing story to be part of. After all, what is a god without a tale worth telling?
And let's hope that tale has a better ending than some of your previous ones.
Alas, the end is never truly the end for the likes of us. There is always another chapter awaiting. Shall we see where this one leads?
Lead the way, Loki. Just remember, not all stories need a villain. Sometimes, a little chaos can be just what's needed to bring about a new beginning.
Then let chaos reign—if only for a moment—and may the new beginnings forged from it be as magnificent as the phoenix rising from the ashes. Or in this case, as resilient as the structure before us.
You know, Wanda, I can't help but feel like that giraffe's all of us trying to get a sip of water after a massive fight. All awkward and just hoping not to face-plant.
It does require a surprising amount of balance and grace... qualities that are often more challenging to harness than one might expect.
Oh for sure, especially when you can go from micro to macro in a heartbeat. It's like trying to do ballet after switching between quantum and regular sizes. You get all... discombobulated.
Indeed. Harnessing one's power without succumbing to the inherent dangers is a delicate endeavor. Much like the giraffe bending to drink without becoming vulnerable to predators.

And hey, they’ve got the whole height thing going on too. Reminds me of that time I first went Giant-Man. I was all legs and arms, trying not to trip over myself. Probably could've used a few pointers from our long-necked friend here.
Your adaptability is commendable, though. Not unlike the giraffe, you've learned to maneuver through various scales, a necessary skill for survival... and certainly for saving the world.

I appreciate that, Wanda. But let's be real, you've got the whole reality-warping power gig; I bet you could just make the water come to you. One flick of the wrist and bam, no more awkward giraffe yoga.
Perhaps, but sometimes bending to meet nature's challenges, rather than reshaping them to our will, can be a humbling and necessary experience.
Humbling, huh? Guess that's one way to keep your feet on the ground. Or, in this case, keeping your hooves in the water.
Exactly, Scott. And there's a certain beauty in that struggle, isn't there? A reminder of the strength found in vulnerability.
